name: places/ChIJvZ8UoN5YwokRK89TIeMw6c0
formattedAddress: 22 N Loop Rd, New York, NY 10044, USA
adrFormatAddress: 22 N Loop Rd, New York, NY 10044, USA

editorialSummary.text: Hip hotel featuring a restaurant, breakfast & a gym, plus polished quarters with city views.

originalText.text: This hotel is so cool. Very unique. We loved that it was on Roosevelt Island. Just far enough away from the city but not too far. An easy tram ride over. But the hotel has a very different approach and feel to it than any other hotel I’ve stayed at. So fun! The staff is top notch!! Great restaurant and rooftop bar with amazing views of the city.

text.text: This hotel is so cool. Very unique. We loved that it was on Roosevelt Island. Just far enough away from the city but not too far. An easy tram ride over. But the hotel has a very different approach and feel to it than any other hotel I’ve stayed at. So fun! The staff is top notch!! Great restaurant and rooftop bar with amazing views of the city.

originalText.text:
We recently stayed at the Graduate New York hotel based on a friend's recommendation, with the expectation of enjoying a wonderful view of the city. Unfortunately, my experience fell short of expectations.
Pros:
•	Early Check-In: We appreciated the hotel's flexibility in allowing us to check in earlier than the scheduled time, given they had a spare room available.
Cons:
•	Room View: Despite choosing this hotel for its promised breathtaking view, our room had a disappointing window view that barely showcased anything of significance.
•	Cleanliness Issues: The state of the room left much to be desired. The room desk was dusty, and there were only traces of toilet paper, an oversight that seems quite ridiculous. Additionally, the shower experience was compromised as shower gels and shampoos were almost empty, making it challenging to use. The shower opener was also difficult to turn, adding to the inconvenience.
•	Closed Rooftop Bar: One of the main attractions that drew us to this hotel was the rooftop bar with its promised spectacular view. However, to our dismay, the bar was closed during our stay, and we were not given access. This was a major letdown.
•	Transportation Issues: The shuttle tube service, which we were relying on for convenient transportation, did not operate smoothly. On a Sunday, it skipped some stations, making our travel more complicated
If you are looking for a hotel with a fantastic view and reliable amenities, I would advise exploring other options.

originalText.text:
Beautiful view!
Quiet area with street parking and tram and ferry conveniently right within walking distance.
The elevator up to the roof top bar closes an hour before closing so plan accordingly. We didn't know and weren't able to go up the night we planned to.

text.text:
Beautiful view!
Quiet area with street parking and tram and ferry conveniently right within walking distance.
The elevator up to the roof top bar closes an hour before closing so plan accordingly. We didn't know and weren't able to go up the night we planned to.

originalText.text:
Pricey during Christmas and New year and for the money we expected a better experience.
Very noisy air conditioning heating system which will wake you up if you are a light sleeper.
Sadly lacking in hanging cupboard space relative to room size, we had junior suite plus a regular room.
No baggage rack or place to put suitcases.
No coffee machine or kettle in room.
Toiletries lacking apart from shower soap dispensers in shower cubicle, no shower caps etc provided.
House keeping random and not particularly thorough, our room was not made up 1 day in 6. Water was not replaced in rooms, had to ask for them at front desk 4 days in 6.
Access to panorama floor is not permitted under 21,  how is it possible a family can’t take their 20 year olds to the top to see the view? Photo ID required to go there even for Pensioners. We were told to return with photo ID by a particular ‘jobs worth’ at the elevator and then when we returned another just waved us into the elevator and glanced at them. What’s the point of photo ID for legal aged hotel guest adults? You need to review this policy or educate the ‘more than my jobs worth’ elderly security guard who was on duty that night.
On the good side, the location is brilliant with the tramway around the corner which makes a walk to Central Park 15 minutes and subway connections first class. The staff on the front desk are excellent / friendly and efficient.
Would I stay here again? Probably not when prices are elevated but at another time I might as it really is a convenient location and you can get away from the constant noise of Manhattan

originalText.text: This hotel was a blessing during Avery challenging time!  The staff is amazing and they made the stay so welcoming!  I highly recommend the visit. So easy to get to the  city from the island using the fun Tram!
